Key Match Events: Phoenix Suns rode an 11-0 run late in the fourth quarter to come back, send the game to overtime and hand the Clippers a loss in their Intuit Dome debut.
Kevin Durant led the charge for Phoenix, scoring 25 points and hitting a number of clutch fourth-quarter buckets before nailing a game-tying fadeaway jumper to send the game to overtime.
Clippers point guard James Harden contributed a near 30-point triple-double while center Ivica Zubac poured in 21 points of his own shooting 8-for-13 from the field.
Post-Match Reflections: The Clippers missed and will continue to miss Kawhi Leonard indefinitely, but the Clippers showed lots of promise without their No. 1.
The energy around this team also appears to be greater than before, which is only increased with the new arena.
The Clippers’ new sense of independence seemed to generate electricity that wasn’t there when the Clippers shared an arena with the NBA’s most popular team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Clippers’ new arena, Intuit Dome, has already generated a lot of excitement and electricity, with 'The Wall' seating style going viral on social media.
Kevin Durant admitted that 'The Wall' even rattled him, a future first-ballot Hall of Famer in his 18th year in the NBA.
Others: The Clippers are going to have to continue to feed off the energy their fans are giving them if they want a shot at the playoffs.
The Clippers’ next game is on the road against the Denver Nuggets on October 26.
